item.title: Writing functions in R
item.description: library(tidyverse) Today we will be learning to write our own functions in R. Consider the discrete Logistic growth function: \[x_{t+1} = x_t + r x_t \left(1 - \frac{x_t}{K} \right)\] Here we exress this function in R: growth <- function(xt, r, K){ r * xt * (1 - xt / K) } We can simulate the function as follows: simulate <- function(max_time, x0, r, K){ x <- numeric(max_time) x[1] <- x0 for (t in 1:(max_time - 1)) { x[t + 1] <- x[t] + growth(x[t], r = r, K) } pop_data <- data_frame(time = 1:max_time, pop_size = x) pop_data } We can perform a few simulations with different values of r:
